info.description: This is the Gambio GX Restful API documentation for the GX shop software. You can find out more about Gambio at [http://www.gambio.de](http://www.gambio.de).
info.title: API v2

get.description: Get all address formats or a single address format.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of address formats

delete.description: Remove an address record from the system. This method will always return success even if the address record does not exist (due to internal architecture decisions, which strive to avoid unnecessary failures).

parameters.name: address_id
parameters.description: The ID of the address to be removed

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the deleted addressID

get.description: Get a single address record through a GET requets. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation.

parameters.name: address_id
parameters.description: The ID of the address to fetch

200.description: Upon success, returns the address that was fetched

put.description: Update an existing address record by providing new data. You do not have to provide the full presentation of the address in the JSON string of the request, rather just the fields to be updated. The address ID will be taken from the URI of the request so it is not required that it is included withing the request JSON.

parameters.name: address_id
parameters.description: The ID of the address to be updated

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated address

get.description: Get multiple address records through a GET request. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation.

200.description: Upon success, returns the address that was fetched

post.description: Create an address record for a customer in the system.

200.description: Upon success, returns the newly created address

post.description: If an email contains an attachment this must be uploaded before the email is sent. This method accepts the upload of one file at a time. It will return its temporary path which can be used as the attachment path in the email JSON data. The name of the file form field is not taken into concern (can be whatever). The important rule is that only one file will be uploaded at a time and that you are sending the Content-Type: multipart/form-data header instead of application/json.

201.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the attachment path

delete.description: Clear the shop cache with a DELETE request.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response

delete.description: Removes the category icon file from the server. This method will always provide a successful response even if the image file was not found.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the deleted filename

get.description: Returns a list of all category icon files which exists in the servers filesystem through a GET request.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of filenames

post.description: Upload an icon image for the categories. Make sure this request with Content-Type: multipart/form-data header instead of application/json. Except from the file the POST request must also contain a "filename" value with the final filename.

201.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the filename

put.description: Use this method to rename an existing icon file.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the updated filename

delete.description: Removes the category image file from the server. This method will always provide a successful response even if the image file was not found.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the deleted filename

get.description: Get a list of all category image files which exists in the server's filesystem through a GET request.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of filenames

post.description: Uploads an icon image for the categories. Make sure this request with Content-Type: multipart/form-data header instead of application/json. Except from the file the POST request must also contain a "filename" value with the final filename.

201.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the newly uploaded filename

put.description: Use this method to rename an existing image file.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the renamed filename

get.description: Get a single country. This method is currently limited to only fetching a single country resource so make sure that you provide the country ID in the request URI.

200.description: Upon success, returns the country resource.

get.description: Get a single countrys zones. This method is currently limited to only fetching a single countrys zone resource so make sure that you provide the country ID in the request URI.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of country zone resources.

post.description: Set a trigger for the ImageProcessing cronjob to regenerate the product images using a POST request.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response

delete.description: Removes a customer groups record from the system. This method will always return success even if the customer group does not exist.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the customer group ID that was deleted

get.description: Get multiple or a single customer groups record through the GET method

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of customer groups

patch.description: Use this method if you want to update an existing customer groups record.

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated customer group

post.description: This method enables the creation of a new CustomerGroups into the system.

201.description: Upon success, returns the newly created customer group

delete.description: Removes customer records from the system. This method will always return success even if the customers do not exist (due to internal CustomerWriteService architecture decisions, which strive to avoid unnecessary failures). An example script to demonstrate how to delete a customer is located under `./docs/REST/samples/customer-service/remove_account.php` in the git clone.

parameters.name: customer_ids
parameters.description: A comma-seperated list of customer IDs to delete

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the deleted customer IDs

get.description: Get customer records through the GET method. This resource supports the following GET parameters as described in the first section of documentation: sorting minimization, search, pagination and links. Additionally you can filter customers by providing the GET parameter "type=guest" or "type=registree". Sort and pagination GET parameters do not apply when a single customer record is selected (e.g. api.php/v2/customers/84). An example script to demonstrate how to fetch customer data is located under `./docs/REST/samples/customer-service/get_admin_data.php` in the git clone **Important**: Currently the CustomerReadService does not support searching in address information of a customer.

200.description: Upon success, returns the an array of customers.

post.description: This method enables the creation of new customers (whether registree or a guest). Additionally the user can provide new address information or just set the id of an existing one. Check the examples bellow. An example script to demonstrate the creation of a new customer is located under `./docs/REST/samples/customer-service/create_account.php` in the git clone, another one to demonstrate the creation of a guest customer is located under `./docs/REST/samples/customer-service/create_guest_account.php`.

201.description: Upon success, returns the customer that was created

put.description: Use this method to update multiple existing customer records. It takes an array of GXCustomer Objects, identified by their id property.

parameters.name: GXCustomerArray
parameters.description: An array of products to update.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of the updated customers

get.description: Get a single customer record through the GET method. This resource supports the following GET parameters as described in the first section of documentation: sorting minimization, search, pagination and links. Additionally you can filter customers by providing the GET parameter "type=guest" or "type=registree". Sort and pagination GET parameters do not apply when a single customer record is selected (e.g. api.php/v2/customers/84). An example script to demonstrate how to fetch customer data is located under `./docs/REST/samples/customer-service/get_admin_data.php` in the git clone **Important**: Currently the CustomerReadService does not support searching in address information of a customer.

200.description: Upon success, returns the customer with the provided ID

put.description: This method will update the information of an existing customer record. You will need to provide all the customer information with the request (except from password and customer id). Also note that you only have to include the "addressId" property. An example script to demonstrate how to update the admin accounts telephone number is located under `./docs/REST/samples/customer-service/update_admin_telephone.php` in the git clone.

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated customer

post.description: Returns multiple customers that are respecting the given search condition. Further information about defining a search condition can be found in the Search Example.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of customers

delete.description: Delete an email record from database. To see an example usage take a look at `docs/REST/samples/email-service/remove_email.php`.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the deleted ID

get.description: Get a single email record through the GET method. This resource supports the following GET parameters as described in the first section of documentation: sorting minimization, search, pagination. Additionally you can filter emails by providing the GET parameter "state=pending" or "state=sent". These filter parameters do not apply when a single emails record is selected (e.g. api.php/v2/emails/84) or when the emails are searched by the "q" parameter. To see an example usage take a look at `docs/REST/samples/email-service/fetch_email.php`

200.description: Upon success, returns an email

post.description: This method will send and save a new or an existing email to the system. If you include mail attachments then they must already exist in the server. You will need to provide the full path to the file. To see an example usage take a look at `docs/REST/samples/email-service/send_email.php`

201.description: Upon success, returns the email send

put.description: This method will queue a new email so that it can be send later (with the POST method). See the "post" method for parameter description. To see an example usage take a look at `docs/REST/samples/email-service/queue_email.php`

200.description: Upon success, returns the email that was queued.

get.description: Get multiple languages record through the GET method

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of languages

delete.description: Removes a manufacturers record from the system. This method will always return success even if the manufacturers does not exist (due to internal ManufacturersWriteService architecture decisions, which strive to avoid unnecessary failures).

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the deleted manufacturer ID

get.description: Get a single manufacturers record through the GET method

200.description: Upon success, returns a manufacturers

patch.description: Use this method if you want to update an existing manufacturers record.

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated manufacturer

get.description: Get multiple manufacturers record through the GET method

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of manufacturers

post.description: This method enables the creation of a new Manufacturers into the system.

201.description: Upon success, returns the created manufacturer

post.description: Returns multiple manufacturers that are respecting the given search condition. Further information about defining a search condition can be found in the Search Example.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of categories

delete.description: Removes a order status record from the system. This method will always return success.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the order status ID that was deleted

get.description: Get a single order status entries.

200.description: Upon success, returns an order status

put.description: This method updates a order status in the database.

201.description: Upon success, returns the updated order status

400.description: (Order status ID invalid or missing data)

get.description: Get a multiple order status entries.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of order statuses

post.description: This method creates a new order status in the database.

201.description: Upon success, returns the order status that was created

delete.description: Remove an entire Order record from the database. This method will also remove the order-items along with their attributes and the order-total records. To see an example usage take a look at `docs/REST/samples/order-service/remove_order.php`

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the order ID

get.description: Get a single order record through a GET request. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation. Important: Whenever you make requests that will return multiple orders the response will contain a smaller version of each order record called order-list-item. This is done for better performance because the creation of a complete order record takes significant time (many objects are involved). If you still need the complete data of an order record you will have to make an extra GET request with the ID provided.

200.description: Upon success, returns the order resource

put.description: Use this method to update an existing order record. It uses the complete order JSON resource so it might be useful to fetch it through a GET request, alter its values and PUT it back in order to perform the update operation. Take a look in the POST method for more detailed explanation on every resource property. To see an example usage take a look at `docs/REST/samples/order-service/update_order.php`

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated order

delete.description: Use this method to remove an order item from an existing order.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with order and item ID

get.description: Get a single order item from an existing order. All the GET manipulation parameters are applied with this method (search, sort, minimize, paginate etc).

200.description: Upon success, returns a single order item

put.description: Use this method to update an existing order item. Use the same order item JSON format as in the POST method.

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated orders items

404.description: (Order item ID does not exist in given order)

delete.description: Removes a single order item attribute/property entry from an existing order item record.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the relevant IDs

get.description: Returns single order item attribute/property record through a GET request. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation.

200.description: Upon success, returns the order items attributes

put.description: Use this method to update an existing order item attribute record. It uses the same attribute JSON format as in the "Create Order Item Attribute" method.

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated order item attributes

delete.description: Use this method to remove an order total from an existing order.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the order and order total ID

404.description: (Order total ID does not exist in given order)

put.description: Use this method to update an existing order total. Use the same order total JSON format as in the POST method.

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated order totals

get.description: Get multiple order list item records through a GET request. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation. Important: Whenever you make requests that will return multiple orders the response will contain a smaller version of each order record called order-list-item. This is done for better performance because the creation of a complete order record takes significant time (many objects are involved). If you still need the complete data of an order record you will have to make an extra GET request with the ID provided.

200.description: Upon success, returns the order list item resources

post.description: This method enables the creation of a new order into the system. The order can be bound to an existing customer or be standalone as implemented in the OrderService. Make sure that you check the Order resource representation. To see an example usage take a look at `docs/REST/samples/order-service/create_order.php`.

201.description: Upon success, returns the order that was created

get.description: Returns multiple order status history records. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of Order Histories

get.description: Returns multiple or a single order status history records. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation.

200.description: Upon success, returns a single Order History

get.description: Get multiple order items from an existing order. All the GET manipulation parameters are applied with this method (search, sort, minimize, paginate etc).

200.description: Upon success, returns a an array of order items

post.description: Use this method to create a new order item to an existing order. The order item JSON format must be the same with the "items" entries in the original order item.

201.description: Upon success, returns the created order item

get.description: Returns multiple order item attribute/property records through a GET request. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of attributes

get.description: Get the payment details for a specific order record through a GET request. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation.

200.description: Upon success, returns the payment details of the order resource

get.description: Returns all single order totals from an existing order. All the GET manipulation parameters are applied with this method (search, sort, minimize, paginate etc).

200.description: Upon success, returns one or many order totals

post.description: Creates a new order total entry to the existing order. The order total JSON format must be the same with the "totals" entries in the original order total.

201.description: Upon success, returns the order total

get.description: Returns a single order total from an existing order. All the GET manipulation parameters are applied with this method (search, sort, minimize, paginate etc).

200.description: Upon success, returns one order total

get.description: Get an array of all tracking code records of an order through the GET method.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of Tracking Codes

post.description: Create a new tracking code for an order.

parameters.name: GXTrackingCodeRequestBody
parameters.description: The tracking code to be created

201.description: Upon success, returns the newly created tracking code.

get.description: Get an array of all tracking code records of an order through the GET method.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of Tracking Codes

post.description: Create a new tracking code for an order. See GXTrackingCode resource.

parameters.name: GXTrackingCode
parameters.description: The tracking code to be created.

201.description: Upon success, returns the newly created tracking code.

patch.description: Use this method if you want to update the status of an existing order and create an order history entry. The status history entry must also contain extra information as shown in the JSON example.

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated order status

post.description: Use this method to create a new order item attribute to an existing order item. The order item attribute JSON object is the same as the one included in the full order representation. There are two different order item variation systems in the shop, the "attributes" and the "properties". Both of them define a variation of an order item (e.g. color, size etc). You must always use only one of them for a single order item.

201.description: Upon success, returns the order item attributes

post.description: Returns multiple orders that are respecting the given search condition. Further information about defining a search condition can be found in the Search Example.

200.description: Upon success, returns the order list item resources

get.description: Get a single order history record through a GET request.

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: The order ID to GET history for.

200.description: Upon success, returns the order history resource

delete.description: Removes a parcel service entity from the system. This method will always return success even if the parcel service does not exist.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the deleted parcel service ID

get.description: Get a single parcel service record through the GET method.

200.description: Upon success, returns the parcel service entity by given id

put.description: Use this method if you want to update an existing parcel service.

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated parcel service

400.description: (Missing or invalid id, missing or invalid request body)

get.description: Get multiple parcel services records through the GET method.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of parcel services

post.description: This method enables the creation of a new parcel service into the system.

201.description: Upon success, returns the newly parcel service offer

post.description: Returns multiple parcel services that are respecting the given search condition. Further information about defining a search condition can be found in the Search Example.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of parcel services

get.description: Get the payment details for a specific order record through a GET request. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation.

200.description: Upon success, returns the payment details of the order resource

delete.description: Remove the product image file from the server. This method will always provide a successful response, even if the image file was not found.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the deleted filename

get.description: Get a list of all product image files which exists in the server's filesystem through a GET request.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of files

post.description: Uploads an image file for the products. Make this request without the "Content-Type: application/json". Except from the file the POST request must also contain a "filename" value with the final filename.

201.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the new filename

put.description: Use this method to rename an existing image file.

200.description: Upon success, returns the old and new name

delete.description: Deletes all customer group- and graduated prices of a product. This method will always return success even if the product does not exist.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the product id of the deleted prices

get.description: Get prices for customer groups and their graduated prices, if exists.

200.description: Upon success, returns all price information for the given product

put.description: Updates product price data for the product of the given id. All price information gets replaced with the new one.

200.description: Upon success, returns all price information for the updated product

get.description: Get price information for given customer group and product quantity. Graduated- and customer group prices are included in the response

200.description: Upon success, returns price information for the given customer group and quantity

delete.description: Deletes an existing product to category link. If there is no categoryId property set, all the product links will be removed.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: The product or category link ID

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the product ID

get.description: Get all product or category links associated with a specific product.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of IDs for product or category links

post.description: Creates a new product to category record in the system.

201.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the product and category ID

put.description: Changes an existing product to category link.

parameters.name: GXProductLinkPutRequest
parameters.description: The old and new category ID

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the product ID and category IDs

delete.description: Removes multiple product records from the database.

parameters.name: product_ids
parameters.description: A comma-seperated list of product IDs to delete

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the deleted product IDs

get.description: Get a multiple product records through a GET request. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation. To see an example usage take a look at `docs/REST/samples/product-service/remove_product.php`

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of products.

post.description: Creates new product records in the system. May be provided an array of product records, for bulk insertion. For single insertion, provide a single GXProduct object.

201.description: Upon success, returns the newly created product(s)

put.description: Use this method to update multiple existing product records. It takes an array of GXProduct Objects, identified by their id property.

parameters.name: GXProductArray
parameters.description: An array of products to update.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of the updated products

get.description: Get a single product record through a GET request. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation. To see an example usage take a look at `docs/REST/samples/product-service/remove_product.php`

200.description: Upon success, returns the specified product.

put.description: Use this method to update an existing product record. Take a look in the POST method for more detailed explanation on every resource property. To see an example usage consider `docs/REST/samples/product-service/update_product.php`

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated product

get.description: Get prices for customer groups and their graduated prices, if exists.

200.description: Upon success, returns all price information for the given product

put.description: Updates product price data for the product of the given id. All price information gets replaced with the new one.

200.description: Upon success, returns all price information for the updated product

get.description: Get price information for given customer group and product quantity. Graduated- and customer group prices are included in the response

200.description: Upon success, returns price information for the given customer group and quantity

post.description: Returns multiple products that are respecting the given search condition. Further information about defining a search condition can be found in the Search Example.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of products

delete.description: Removes a quantity units record from the system. This method will always return success even if the quantity unit does not exist.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the deleted quantityID

get.description: Get a single quantity unit record through the GET method

200.description: Upon success, returns a Quantity Unit

patch.description: Use this method if you want to update an existing quantity units record.

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated Quantity Unit

get.description: Get multiple quantity unit records through the GET method

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of Quantity Units

post.description: This method enables the creation of a new QuantityUnits into the system.

200.description: Upon success, returns the newly created Quantity Unit

delete.description: Removes a review record from the database.

parameters.name: review_id
parameters.description: The ID of the review to be removed

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the review ID

get.description: Get a single review through the GET method.

200.description: Upon success, returns a GXReview

put.description: Use this method to update an existing review record.

201.description: Upon success, returns the updated review

400.description: (Empty request body / Review record ID was not provided or is invalid)

get.description: Get an array of all review records through the GET method.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of Reviews

post.description: Create a new review.

201.description: Upon success, returns the newly created review.

get.description: Returns shop information like shop url, shop name, shop owner address data, shop template name and shop version.

200.description: Returns the shop information

delete.description: Removes a special offer record from the system. This method will always return success even if the vpe does not exist.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the deleted special offer ID

get.description: Gets a single special offer record through the GET method.

200.description: Upon success, returns the special offer entity by given id

put.description: Use this method if you want to update an existing special offer.

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated special offer

400.description: (Missing or invalid id, missing or invalid request body)

get.description: Get multiple special offers record through the GET method.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of paginated special offer items

post.description: This method enables the creation of a new special offer into the system.

201.description: Upon success, returns the newly created special offer

post.description: Returns multiple special offers that are respecting the given search condition. Further information about defining a search condition can be found in the Search Example.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of special offers

get.description: Get all tax classes or a single tax class including tax rates.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of tax classes

get.description: Get all tax rates or a single tax rate.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of tax rates

get.description: Get all tax zones or a single tax zone.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of tax zones

delete.description: Removes a tracking code record from the database.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the tracking code ID

get.description: Get a single tracking code through the GET method.

200.description: Upon success, returns a GXTrackingCode

get.description: Get an array of all tracking code records through the GET method.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of Tracking Codes

delete.description: Removes a tracking code record from the database.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the tracking code ID

get.description: Get a single tracking code through the GET method.

200.description: Upon success, returns a GXTrackingCode

get.description: Get an array of all tracking code records through the GET method.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of Tracking Codes

delete.description: Removes a vpe record from the system. This method will always return success even if the vpe does not exist (due to internal VPEWriteService architecture decisions, which strive to avoid unnecessary failures).

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the deleted VPE ID

get.description: Get a single vpe record through the GET method

200.description: Upon success, returns a VPE

patch.description: Use this method if you want to update an existing vpe record.

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated VPE

post.description: This method enables the creation of a new VPE into the system.

201.description: Upon success, returns the newly created VPE

delete.description: Removes a withdrawal record from the database.

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the withdrawal ID

get.description: Get a single withdrawal through the GET method.

200.description: Upon success, returns a GXWithdrawal

put.description: Use this method to update an existing withdrawal record.

201.description: Upon success, returns the updated withdrawal

400.description: (Empty request body / Withdrawal record ID was not provided or is invalid)

get.description: Get an array of withdrawals through the GET method.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of withdrawals

post.description: Create a new withdrawal.

201.description: Upon success, returns the newly created withdrawal

get.description: Get a single registered zone resource. This method is currently limited to only fetching a single zone and might be updated in a future version of the API.

200.description: Upon success, returns the zone resource

delete.description: Removes multiple category records from the database, provided a comma-seperated list of IDs to delete.

parameters.name: category_ids
parameters.description: A comma-seperated list of category IDs to delete

200.description: Upon success, returns the default success response with the deleted category IDs

get.description: Get multiple category records through a GET request. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation. To see an example usage take a look at `docs/REST/samples/category-service/fetch_category.php`

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of categories

post.description: Creates new categories in the system by taking an array of categories. It is also possible to provide a single GXCategory ressource, to create a single entry.

201.description: Upon success, returns the categories that was created

put.description: Use this method to update multiple existing category records. It takes an array of GXCategory Objects, updating them based on their id property.

parameters.name: GXCategoryArray
parameters.description: An array of categories to update.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of the updated categories

get.description: Get a single category record through a GET request. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation. To see an example usage take a look at `docs/REST/samples/category-service/fetch_category.php`

200.description: Upon success, returns a category

put.description: Use this method to update an existing category record. Take a look in the POST method for more detailed explanation on every resource property. To see an example usage take a look at `docs/REST/samples/category-service/update_category.php`

parameters.name: GXCategory
parameters.description: An array of categories to update.

200.description: Upon success, returns the updated category

400.description: (Empty request body / Category record ID was not provided or is invalid)

get.description: Get multiple product records of an specified category through a GET request. Using the `recursive` query parameter allows you to receive the products from the sub categories.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of products

get.description: Get multiple or a single sub category records of a given category through a GET request. This method supports all the GET parameters that are mentioned in the "Introduction" section of this documentation.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of categories

post.description: Returns multiple categories that are respecting the given search condition. Further information about defining a search condition can be found in the Search Example.

200.description: Upon success, returns an array of categories

priceStatus.description: Provide: "0" for normal, "1" for price on request and "2" for not available for purchase.

example.text: This is an example review text!

orderId.description: A tracking code is bound to an order on creation.

example.content: This is an example for a withdrawal's content.

search.description: Contains the search condition. Further information can be found on the Search Example page.

changed.name: changed
changed.description: *Optional parameter*. If provided, receive a change history of items that were **changed/deleted** at the given date.

deleted.name: deleted
deleted.description: *Optional parameter*. If provided, receive a change history of items that were **deleted** at the given date.

modified.name: modified
modified.description: *Optional parameter*. If provided, receive a change history of items that were **modified** at a given date.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: *Optional parameter*. If provided limits the properties to be included in the response.

page.name: page
page.description: *Optional parameter*. If provided, displays the specified page. Defaults to 0.

per_page.name: per_page
per_page.description: *Optional parameter*. If provided, limits the amount of records in the response. Defaults to 50.

search.name: search
search.description: *Optional parameter*. Search for a url-encoded keyword.

sort.name: sort
sort.description: *Optional parameter*. Sorts by the desired properties. Maximum sorting fields are 5. (prefix property with + for ascending, - for descending)

recursive.name: recursive
recursive.description: *Optional parameter*. If provided, recursively includes the ressources child-resources.
